abstract: Rafael Medoff, director of David S Wyman Institute for Holocaust Studies, releases comic book The Book That Hitler Didn’t Want You to Read; work, which is retelling of how Hitler sued Alan Cranston for copyright infringement in 1939 after Cranston produced version of book Mein Kampf, is part of educational series for young adults.
lead_paragraph: “The Book That Hitler Didn’t Want You to Read,” from the Wyman Institute for Holocaust Studies, has as its hero the future Senator Alan Cranston.

headline.main: Comic Book Recalls Effort to Expose ‘Mein Kampf’
headline.print_headline: Revisiting an Effort to Expose the Evils of ‘Mein Kampf’

snippet: “The Book That Hitler Didn’t Want You to Read,” from the Wyman Institute for Holocaust Studies, has as its hero the future Senator Alan Cranston.
